replies.context: Yup. Consumers overspend wildly in the US. I've got some great earbuds that cost me about $12. I've had them for around 7 years.
My wireless ones were 15 bucks.  I love them.

context: There is still very minimal true 4k content right now. kinda pointless to upgrade at these prices.

replies.context: netflix and Amazon have quite a bit.  You just need the bandwidth

context: Anything that real people can afford?
You average Joe will be able to afford everything here.  sheeesh

It just doesn't take much to satisfy simple minds now days.  Well, takes spending 10 to 100 times what a product is really worth, but keep it up.  All of you who can't resist buying these newer model toys at crazy high prices are doing a really good job at fueling our retirements.  Too bad you'll never get to experience that.
Wow...this is more an ad for the most expensive useless gadgets. What's your commision???

My current phone has this one really great feature that I use almost exclusively.  I type in a series of numbers (usually 10), press a button, and shazam . . . there is somebody on the other end that I need to talk to.  It's a wonderful feature, really.

On my second I phone and the problems still abound and just about the time I recover from the Tech Dumping everything to get Factory Defaults to return another problem jumps up, this time it's voice clipping. 
I'm looking forward to Bill gates offering an operating system that doesn't crash and has built in, self supporting malware and anti virus. Why is a product offered with built in flaws? Like buying a Lexus without wheels.
I'm 80 BTW and don't need the aggravation !
$329 for earbuds. My hearing ain't that good.
